theme.docs.translationNotice.message: This page has been automatically translated using AI and may contain errors or inaccuracies. component.askMenu.claude.desc.message: Chat with Claude AI about this page

component.archetype.intro.message: To create and scaffold a new {project} project, follow these steps:

component.archetype.step1.desc.message: Open a terminal and move to the folder where you want to create your new project.

component.archetype.step2.desc.message: Use the Maven command below, and customize the groupId, artifactId, and version as needed for your project.

component.archetype.table.archetypeGroup.message: The group ID of the archetype is com.webforj for webforJ archetypes.

component.archetype.table.archetypeArtif.message: Specifies the name of the archetype to use.

component.archetype.table.archetypeVersi.message: Specifies the version of the archetype to use. This ensures that the generated project is compatible with a specific archetype version. Using LATEST selects the most recent version available.

component.archetype.table.groupId.desc.message: Represents the namespace for the generated project. Typically structured like a Java package, such as org.example and is used to uniquely identify your organization or project domain.

component.archetype.table.artifactId.des.message: Specifies the name of the generated project. This will be the name of the resulting artifact and the project folder.

component.archetype.table.version.desc.message: Defines the version of the generated project. A common convention is MAJOR.MINOR-SNAPSHOT, like 1.0-SNAPSHOT, where SNAPSHOT denotes that the project is still in development.

component.archetype.table.flavor.spring.message: webforJ app with Spring Boot support (requires webforJ 25.02 or higher).

component.archetype.table.appName.desc.message: An optional parameter that can be used in the generated project's POM file. Depending on the used webforJ archetype, it can be utilized as a default title for the application.

component.archetype.conclusion.message: After running the command, Maven will generate the project files necessary to run the project.

tableBuilder.sections.shadowParts.description: Section heading for shadow parts table

tableBuilder.descriptions.shadowParts.message: These are the {shadowDomLink} parts for the {componentName} component, which are required for styling with CSS.

tableBuilder.descriptions.slots.message: These are the slots available for use within the {componentName} component. These slots act as placeholders within the component that control where the children of a customized element are inserted within the shadow tree.

tableBuilder.sections.cssProperties.description: Section heading for CSS properties table

tableBuilder.descriptions.cssProperties.message: These are the CSS properties that are used in the {componentName} component, with a short description of their use.

tableBuilder.descriptions.properties.message:
These are the properties for the {componentName} component. Properties are JavaScript variables associated with client web components. They are useful for storing data and controlling behavior, and make web components more reusable and easier to configure.

Some properties reflect their values to attributes and vice versa. This means that if you set a property, the corresponding attribute is set automatically, and if you set an attribute, the corresponding property is set automatically.

tableBuilder.sections.reflectedAttribute.description: Section heading for reflected attributes table

tableBuilder.descriptions.reflectedAttri.message: These are the reflected attributes for the {componentName} component. Reflected attributes appear as attributes in the rendered HTML element for the component in the DOM. This means that styling can be applied using these attributes.

tableBuilder.descriptions.events.message: These are the events for the {componentName} component.

tableBuilder.descriptions.methods.message: These are the methods for the {componentName} component.

tableBuilder.descriptions.dependentCompo.message: The following components depend on the {componentName} component.

tableBuilder.descriptions.dependencies.message: The {componentName} component relies on the following client components. Client components are client-side only, and cannot be instantiated directly. See the related article for more detailed styling information.

componentDemo.showCode.description: Button text to show the code section

expandableCode.hideCode.description: Button text to hide the expanded code

expandableCode.showAllLines.description: Button text to show all lines of code

componentArchetype.instructions.description: Instructions for creating a new project

componentArchetype.step1.message: {strong}Navigate to the proper directory{/strong}: Open a terminal and move to the folder where you want to create your new project.

componentArchetype.step2.message: {strong}Run the {code}archetype:generate{/code} command{/strong}: Use the Maven command below, and customize the {code}groupId{/code}, {code}artifactId{/code}, and {code}version{/code} as needed for your project.

componentArchetype.finalInstruction.message: After running the command, Maven will generate the project files necessary to run the project.
componentArchetype.finalInstruction.description: Final instruction about Maven generating project files
